flashcards.category: Human Body Systems: Digestion, Respiration & Circulation

cards.front: What is the main purpose of the **Digestive System**?
cards.back: To break down food into small nutrient molecules that can be absorbed into the bloodstream.

cards.front: What is the difference between **Mechanical** and **Chemical** digestion?
cards.back: Mechanical is physical (chewing, churning); Chemical uses enzymes and acid to break molecular bonds.

cards.front: What are **Villi** and why are they important?
cards.back: Finger-like projections in the small intestine that increase surface area for maximum nutrient absorption.

cards.front: What is the function of the **Small Intestine** vs. the **Large Intestine**?
cards.back: Small: Nutrient absorption; Large: Water absorption and waste elimination.

cards.front: What is the main function of the **Respiratory System**?
cards.back: To bring oxygen into the body and remove carbon dioxide waste.
Tiny air sacs in the lungs where gas exchange (O2 in, CO2 out) occurs with the blood.
It is a muscle that contracts (moves down) to pull air into the lungs and relaxes (moves up) to push air out.

cards.front: What are the three main components of the **Circulatory System**?
cards.back: The heart (pump), blood vessels (pipes), and blood (transport fluid).
Arteries carry blood away from the heart; Veins carry blood to the heart; Capillaries are tiny vessels where exchange happens.

cards.front: What are the four chambers of the **Heart**?
cards.back: Right Atrium, Right Ventricle, Left Atrium, Left Ventricle.

cards.front: What is the role of **Red Blood Cells**?
cards.back: They contain hemoglobin to carry oxygen to all the cells in the body.

cards.front: How do the **Digestive and Circulatory** systems work together?
cards.back: The digestive system breaks down food into nutrients, and the circulatory system transports those nutrients to all cells.

cards.front: How do the **Respiratory and Circulatory** systems work together?
cards.back: The respiratory system takes in oxygen, and the circulatory system delivers that oxygen to cells while picking up CO2 to be exhaled.

cards.front: What is the function of **Valves** in the heart and veins?
cards.back: To prevent the backflow of blood, ensuring it only flows in one direction.
